medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe corneal and conjunctival toxicity from long-term use of hydrogen peroxide as an eye wash.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 3 months prior to presentation, characterized by increasing pain, worsening vision, and photophobia in both eyes, left eye being more affected than the right. The patient had used hydrogen peroxide approximately 3 times per week for the past 10 to 15 years. Prior to symptom onset, she denied any complaints.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of pseudophakia, open-angle glaucoma, and presumed ocular-cicatricial pemphigoid.
medical_history.social_history: Currently living in an assisted-care environment with close supervision. Denied use of other topical or oral medications.
